alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:09AM EST until December 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey...Pennsylvania... Delaware River At Riegelsville affecting Hunterdon, Bucks and Mercer Counties. For the Delaware River...including Riegelsville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Delaware River at Riegelsville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, The entrance to Bull Island State Park is closed. Unsafe to cross over to Treasure Island Scout Camp. At 15.0 feet, Treasure Island Scout Camp floods. At 18.0 feet, River Road floods in Pohatcong Township, north of the bridge. At 22.0 feet, Pohatcong Creek floods Creek Road due to high and backwater from the Delaware River. The Musconetcong River also floods Mount Joy Road due to high and backwater from the Delaware River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 22.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.6 feet on 04/09/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Delaware River Riegelsville 22.0 21.6 Tue 10 a 17.7 14.2 22.6 7pm 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
